contentrichtext.text: {{distinguish|Military of the Democratic Republic of the Congo}} {{Refimprove|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox national military |country=Republic of Congo |name=Armed Forces of the Republic of the Congo |native_name={{lang|fr|Forces Armées de la République du Congo}} |image=[[File:Flag of the Republic of the Congo.svg|250px|Flag of the Republic of the Congo]] |caption=Flag of the Republic of the Congo |founded=1960 |current_form= |disbanded= |branches=Army, Air Force, Navy, Gendarmerie, Presidential Guard |headquarters= <!-- Leadership --> |commander-in-chief= |commander-in-chief_title=President |minister= |minister_title=Minister of Defence |commander= |commander_title=Chief of Staff <!-- Manpower --> |age= 20 |active= |reserve= |deployed= <!-- Financial --> |amount=$110 million (FY93) |percent_GDP=3.8% (FY93) <!-- Industrial --> |domestic_suppliers=None |foreign_suppliers= |imports= |exports= <!-- Related aricles --> |history= |ranks= }} The '''Armed Forces of the [[Republic of the Congo]]''' include an Army, the [[Congolese Air Force]], and a Navy (est. 800). Paramilitary organisations include 2,000 Gendarmerie in 20 companies, and a Presidential Guard, possibly organised into a battalion. (IISS 2007, p. 269) On 5 February 2012, there were [[Brazzaville arms dump blasts|munitions explosions]] at a tank regiment (seemingly 'Regiment Blinde') barracks located in [[Brazzaville]]'s fifth [[arrondissement]], [[Ouenze]]. Some 206 people were initially reported killed. There are five military barracks in the city, and after the explosion officials said the government had promised to move all munitions out of the capital.<ref>http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/206-people-dead-arms-depot-explodes-republic-congo-article-1.1033182, accessed 6 February 2012</ref> ==Equipment== ===Tanks=== Tanks are mostly older examples from the USSR. * [[T-54/55]] - 25 * [[Type 59]] - 15 * [[Type 63 (tank)|Type 63]] - 8 * [[PT-76]] - 3 ordered in 1971 from the Soviet Union and delivered in 1972 (the vehicles were second hand) * [[T-34|T-34/85]] ===Infantry fighting vehicles=== *[[Mamba APC]] *[[BTR-152]] *[[BTR-50]] *[[BTR-60]] - 30 *[[ZFB-05]] - 14 ===Self Propelled guns=== * [[ZSU-23-4]] - 8 * [[BM-21 Grad]] - 6 ===Small Arms=== * [[AKM]]<ref name="jones2009">Jones, Richard D. ''Jane's Infantry Weapons 2009/2010''. Jane's Information Group; 35 edition (January 27, 2009). ISBN 978-0-7106-2869-5.</ref> * [[AK-47]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[FN FAL]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[DShK]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[RPK]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[RPD]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[Degtyaryov machine gun|RP-46]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[MAT-49]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[Walther PP]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[TT pistol]]<ref name="jones2009"/> * [[RPG-7]]<ref name="jones2009"/> ===Anti-Aircraft guns=== * [[37 mm automatic air defense gun M1939]] * [[57 mm AZP S-60]] === Aircraft Inventory === [[File:Roundel of the Congolese Air Force.svg|right|thumb|Roundel of the Congolese Air Force]] The Congo's 10 military aircraft, including 3 helicopters, are operated by the Air Force. {| class="wikitable" ! style="text-align: left;"|Aircraft ! style="text-align: left;"|Type ! style="text-align: left;"|Versions ! style="text-align: left;"|In service<ref>[http://www.milaviapress.com/orbat/republicofcongo/index.php Congolese military aviation OrBat]</ref> ! style="text-align: left;"|Notes |- | [[Aérospatiale Alouette II|Aérospatiale SA 318 Alouette II]] || utility helicopter || SA-318C || 1 || |- | [[Aérospatiale Alouette III|Aérospatiale Alouette SA 316 Alouette III]] || utility helicopter || SA-316C || 1 || |- | [[Antonov An-24|Antonov An-24 Coke]] || transport || || 5 || |- | [[Antonov An-26|Antonov An-26 Curl]] || transport || || 1 || |- | [[Eurocopter Dauphin|Eurocopter SA 365 Dauphin]] || utility helicopter || SA-365 || 1 || |- |-[[Mirage F-1]] || fighter || || 2 || |} == References == {{Reflist|2}} {{Military of Africa}} *{{CIA World Factbook|year=2003}} [[Category:Military of the Republic of the Congo| ]] {{RCongo-stub}} {{Africa-mil-stub}}
